txt.en: Bring the sword to Dorach
A small child perches atop this huge boulder
Of Knights and Turtles
'You found it! You found Thumb-cleaver! Oh thank you, thank you! I... think I'm going to train a bit closer to home from now on, until I'm at least taller than those turtles.'
On Loeg Thangalf you found a small sword that had been dropped by Dorach.\n\nYou should bring the sword to Dorach at Mereham, in central Pinnath Gelin.
'Help! Oh, have you seen my baby? My little girl is missing!'

Andrethil is frantic with worry over her missing child, Dorach, who she think may have gone to the nearby island to challenge its fierce dread-turtles.\n\nYou should head to Loeg Thangalf and look for Dorach.
'Oh, hullo. Did mother send you? Thanks for clearing a path through those awful turtles.'

'Help! Oh, have you seen my baby? My little girl, Dorach, is missing! That fool of a child is always wandering off pretending to be a knight like her older sister. I only looked away from her for a moment and she was gone!\n\n'Her sword is missing too, and I fear she's gone on to challenge the turtles on Loeg Thangalf. I tried to explain to her that they are enormous, fierce creatures, and not at all the small turtles she's seen in the river nearby, but I fear that made her all the more determined. Oh please find my girl!'
TBD

'I wanted to name my sword something fierce, like Foe-cleaver or Goblin-head-lopper, or something. But, the first time I drew it I cut my thumb right badly on its edge and my sister named it Thumb-cleaver on me and even laughed when she bound me up! I miss her. And I miss my sword. I hope you find it soon!'
'Words alone cannot express my thanks to you, traveller. I hope she's learned her lesson.'
While searching Loeg Thangalf you managed to find Dorach, who is eager to speak with you.\n\nLoeg Thangalf is in northern Pinnath Gelin.
Talk to Andrethil
You have returned Thumb-cleaver to Dorach, and her mother, Andrethil is waiting now to speak with you.\n\nAndrethil is at Mereham in central Pinnath Gelin.

'I wanted to name my sword something fierce, like Foe-cleaver or Goblin-head-lopper, or something. But, the first time I drew it I cut my thumb right badly on its edge and my sister named it Thumb-cleaver on me and even laughed when she bound me up! I miss her. And I miss my sword. I hope you find it soon!'

'I wanted to name my sword something fierce, like Foe-cleaver or Goblin-head-lopper, or something. But, the first time I drew it I cut my thumb right badly on its edge and my sister named it Thumb-cleaver on me and even laughed when she bound me up! I miss her. And I miss my sword. I hope you find it soon!'
You found Thumb-cleaver!

'Oh, hullo. Did mother send you? Thanks for clearing a path through those awful turtles. When mother said they were bigger, I never thought… well, I can get home on my own now, but please – I lost my sword! It was a gift from Cangwen, and she always says a knight doesn't leave their sword on the ground, but when the turtles showed up I stabbed at one of them and it got stuck in the shell, and and and…'

She sniffles and wipes at her eyes.

'Please find Thumb-cleaver! I think I ran here from over that way.'

She waves an arm towards the north and swallows.
You rescued Dorach, but she's worried about the sword she dropped on the north-eastern part of the Loeg Thangalf. You should retrieve the sword and return it to her.

'Words alone cannot express my thanks to you, traveller. I hope she's learned her lesson. I might not be able to keep her from following in Cangwen's footsteps, nor would I want to, but hopefully she'll be more careful going forward.\n\n'There's bravery and then there's… well, this was a learning experience, I suppose. Oh my poor girl, I am so glad she's home safe.'
Talk to Dorach

Loeg Thangalf island, once home to an ancient Elven family, has been overrun by deadly dread-turtles. There are few who would dare their sharp beaks or brave their shores. One such hopeful hero may need a bit of rescuing.
Search for Dorach's sword
Search for Dorach
